This will be loan number 13 for him with the MFP institution, and thus he is asking for your support so that he can make his plans a reality. At the same time, he is committed once more to fulfilling his payment schedule, as with his previous loans. He also likes being part of his communal bank, since all of its members are very responsible people with a sense of solidarity. 

With the amount he is requesting, 2000 soles, he will stock the little store he has in his home, so he will buy products and grains, as well as seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to buy products and grains to sell and seeds to plant on his land.

loans.name: Gjin

texts.en:
Gjin is a forty-four-year-old married father of three children, who are attending school. They live in a little town in the north of Albania. Gjin owns a mini-bus that he uses for the transportation of locals from the town to the capital city and back. 

At the moment, the vehicle he uses to generate income needs repair. This is the reason why Gjin is requesting a loan of 200,000 Albanian Lek, in hopes that lenders will support him financially. Being the only one to provide financially for his family, he needs to repair the vehicle immediately if possible.

He had another loan in the past that has already been paid off.

loans.use: to repair the mini-bus he uses to transport customers.

loans.name: Morlita

texts.en: Morlita is 49 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Morlita has a business buying and selling native bags in the Philippines. She requested a 17000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more bags to sell. Morlita has been in this business for 18 years. In the future, Morlita would like to save enough money to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell.

loans.name: Priscillah

texts.en:
Priscillah is a 33-year-old woman from Mbale in the Western part of Kenya. She is married to Apollo and they have been blessed with three children, aged six, nine and 12 years old respectively.

She owns a timber and firewood yard and has been in this business for three years. Her monthly income is 14,000 KES. She will use the loan to buy more stock of timber and firewood to sell.

Her dream is to own a number of timber yards within the region. This will help her pay for her children's school fees and also employ more people, thereby creating opportunity in the community where she lives.

loans.use: to buy more stock of timber and firewood to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase second-hand clothes to resell

loans.name: Zelimkhan

texts.en: Zelimkhan is 57 years old. He lives with his wife, mother and aunt. His mother and aunt are provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two milk cows and a calf, whose milk is used in cheese production. Besides, they have 0.4 hectare area of agricultural land, where potatoes and haricot are grown. Zelimkhan sells the harvested products and cheese locally. Zelimkhan is a very hard working man who has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing an additional cow, they will be able to expand the cattle and produce more cheese. This will increase the income of the family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. Zelimkhan awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a hardworking 27-year-old woman. She used her previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She is married and has two children. She sells clothes to earn a living and has been in business for three years. She also relies on her husband's salary. 
Someday she hopes to open a boutique. She needs a loan of 37,513 KES to buy additional bales of clothes.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old woman who owns rental houses from which she earns an income. She used her previous loan to build more rental houses. Her profits increased and she managed to repay her loan. She also relies on her husband's salary as a driver. She is a hardworking and God-fearing lady. Through the loans given to her by Faulu Kenya she has managed to develop her rental business. 
She dreams of building many rental houses. She needs a loan of 32,298 KES to buy iron sheeting, timber and cement.

loans.use: to buy iron sheeting, timber and cement.

loans.name: Clarisse

texts.en: Clarisse is 24 years old. She is married with one child who is three years old. Her husband assists shoppers to carry their things to different places such as a car or home etc. She has been in business for two years. She wants a loan to buy more food goods such as regular fish and little fish, etc. With the profit she will buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy lives in the Kericho area of Kenya, which claims a beautiful countryside. She has four children and has been farming for five years. Her primary income sources are selling milk, eggs and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Milking!' Her biggest challenge is 'insufficient pastures.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chebirir.' She will use the loan of 20,000 KES requested from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a venture into poultry farming.

Daisy was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, 'Their monthly repayment rate.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'Savings are good for us.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked 'How will this loan benefit your family?' Daisy replied 'Broaden the source of income.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Daisy owns a cow and some poultry birds, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has a mosquito net but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and sent the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Reynalda

texts.en:
Reynalda, age 35, is a farmer. She has been engaged in this work for more than seven years now. She and her husband live in San Miguel, Bohol, and have four children.

Reynalda is asking for a loan in order to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. 

In the future, Reynalda dreams of expanding her business. She also wants to save money so that she can continue supporting her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is an ambitious 30-year-old man living in Masindi, Uganda. Three years ago he decided to venture into clothes due to the business's lucrative nature and the fact that less initial capital is required. Price fluctuations and ever-changing customer preferences hinder his business growth while his dream is to own a modern boutique. Robert intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nushe

texts.en:
Nushe, a 40-year-old mother of two, lives with her family in the northwest part of the country. Her children are in their late teens and still attending school. 

Before coming to this new location to reside, they lived in a village very high, up north where the snow covered almost everything for six months and people were locked up in their homes during this time. For as long as they stayed in their homes, they consumed dried food and smoked meat that they had prepared and put aside during the rest of the year.

For the past nine years, they have been living in a village with a milder weather and more prolific as well. Nushe has been involved in the livestock industry that in the last three years has picked up considerably and she is happy; she generates a good income from it. 

The loan she is requesting at the moment is to expand the existing stable.

loans.use: To expand the existing stable

loans.name: Sinasar

texts.en:
Sinasar is 48 years old. He lives in Bolnisi district with his parents, two children and a daughter-in-law. His parents are provided with a retirement pension. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have milk cows and sell milk locally in an open market. Besides, they have a plot of agricultural land, where potatoes, cucumbers and haricots are grown. They sell the harvested products locally.

 Sinasar is very hard-working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan for purchasing feed for cattle. After purchasing the feed the cattle will be fatten properly. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will improve their living conditions. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase feed for the cattle

loans.name: Kebbeh

texts.en: Kebbeh is 40 years old and lives in Sinkor. She’s married and her husband is an electrician. They have four children between 15 and 25 years of age. Three of them are living at home and all are in school. Kebbeh has been selling from a table business (rice, oil, tomatoes, vita, soap, union, and pepper) for the last 20 years. Her main challenge is the slowness of the business sometimes. Her business helps her to earn her own money. She’s requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, tomatoes, vita, soap, union, and pepper. She wants to be a big business woman and keep earning her own money. Kebbeh says she wants to have her own money and have a house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, tomatoes, soap, pepper, etc.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 60 años de edad, es viuda. Tiene 03 hijos los cuales ya son independientes y viven aparte. Ella vive  en compañía de su sobrino, quien la acompaña y apoya en todo momento, habitando una casa que es de  su propiedad.
La actividad que realiza Yolanda es la costura, oficio que aprendió mirando y apoyando a su hermana en un pequeño taller, logrando los conocimientos y experiencia necesaria.  Decidió iniciar su negocio independientemente, contando con  un capital propio fruto de los ahorros con su difunto esposo, comprando una máquina de coser siendo su primera herramienta de trabajo, empezó cociendo y buscando clientes ella sola, hace más de 15 años atrás.
Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja.
Le gusta su trabajo por el ingreso económico que le genera  para poder pagar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, además que le gusta coser, confeccionar lencería, ropas de todos los géneros y modelos. Por otro, no le gusta el cansancio físico por estar largas horas en una misma postura realizando la costura. Pero eso no la desanima,  continua trabajando y esforzándose para seguir progresando deseando en un futuro comprar su máquina remalladora que le facilitaría mucho más su trabajo y crecer en este rubro. Este es el préstamo número 21 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que viene recibiendo y desea seguir contando con este apoyo, por eso se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de su cuotas, como en los préstamos anteriores. Además se siente contenta con el grupo que forma parte, ya que los considera personas responsables  y solidarias
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de materiales para la costura tales como telas, elásticos, hilos y otros, buscando la mejor calidad  a menores precios. De esa manera aumentar su stock de materiales disponibles para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Yolanda is sixty years old and a widow. She has three adult children who live on their own. She lives with her nephew, who always helps and supports her. They live in a home they own.

Yolanda's business is sewing, a trade she learned by watching and helping her sister in a small shop, where she acquired the necessary knowledge and experience. She decided to start her own business by investing her own capital, her and her late husband's savings. She purchased a sewing machine, which is her main work tool, and started sewing and looking for customers on her own, over fifteen years ago.

She considers her business to be profitable because it provides her with good earnings.

She enjoys her work because it generates enough income for her to pay her home expenses, and also because she likes sewing and making lingerie and all types and styles of clothing. On the other hand, she doesn't enjoy the physical exhaustion that comes from staying in the same position for long hours while sewing her work. But she is not disheartened by this, she keeps working and doing her best to continue moving forward. In the future she would like to buy a riveting machine, which would make her job a lot easier and would allow her business to expand. 

This is her 21st loan with MFP. She is grateful for the financial support she has received and wants to continue having it, which is why she is committed to paying her installments as she did with previous loans. She is also happy with the group she belongs to beacuse she considers its members to be responsible and supportive people. 

She will invest the requested amount of 1,500 nuevos soles in purchasing sewing materials, such as fabric, elastics, thread, and other items. She will look for the best quality at the lowest price. This will allow her to increase her stock of available materials for her work.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials like fabric, elastics, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Aleksandre

texts.en:
Aleksandre is 39 years old. He lives in the small village of Tianeti district with his wife and father who was given a retirement pension. Aleksandre owns a minibus and transports people from his village to the capital city. This is a main source of his monthly income.

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have 11 milk cows and five calves. They sell milk locally. Aleksandre is a very hard working man and has a rich experience in his business. He requested a loan to purchase sheep and expand his livestock. This will increase the family's income. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Aleksandre awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Jassa

texts.en:
Jassa lives in Montserrado County in Sinkor, one of the areas that is almost like the center of Monrovia. She is 33 years old and lives with her boyfriend and two children, ages 6 and 9. Her children are attending school. She is a high school graduate. 

She has been running a table for the past ten years where she sells pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onion, okra, etc. in the local market. The profits from her business are used for food and house rent. She started this business with money from her boyfriend. She spends 8 hours working at her business and enjoys the response (buying) from her customers. She uses a taxi to get her goods on her table from the wholesale store.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onion, okra, etc. for her business. 

Her plans is to own a car for doing business.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, rice, palm oil, vita, onion, okra, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Tea

texts.en: Tea is 38 years old. She lives with her husband and daughter in the small village of Kaspi district. The family runs an agricultural business. In particular, they have a milk cow whose milk is used in cheese production. Tea sells cheese locally as well as in the capital city of Tbilisi at a good price. She is a very hard working woman and has a rich experience in her business. She requested a loan for purchasing a milk cow. After purchasing this additional milk cow, she will be able to produce more cheese and thus increase the income of her family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Tea awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is from the village of Dedalauri, West Georgia. He is 52 years old and lives with his wife, his retired mother and three children. David produces various items out of ceramic materials and sells them at the local open market. Also, he is involved in the family agricultural business. They have three milk cows and produce and sell cheese locally. Besides, David has a pig and sells piglets seasonally.

 With the requested loan, David plans to purchase a car. He will use it for transportation of the cheese and ceramic items to nearby towns, where he can sell them for a higher price than locally in the village. This will positively impact the income of the family. David will improve their living conditions with the increased profit. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a car for product transportation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 48-year-old green grocer in Mtwapa Mombasa. She is a married mother of four who is also supported by her husband who is a hotelier. She has been in this business for the last eight years and has done well. 

For her first loan she is requesting funds to purchase green vegetables and fruit for her grocery store. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. She hopes to grow her shop into a wholesale business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and fruit for her grocery store.

loans.name: Delfina

texts.en:
Delfina, 56, lives with her family in a house she has owned for several years. She has a small store where she sells basic staples, snacks and other items. She has been this business for the last four years and has done well. Delfina is a very hardworking woman who engages in various endeavors to have a stable life.

She is asking Yehu for a loan to buy larger amounts of products like flour, basic grains, detergents and instant goods. With this investment, Delfina hopes to improve her profits.

loans.use: to buy larger amounts of products like flour, basic grains, detergents, and instant goods.

loans.name: Imran

texts.en:
Mr. Imran, age 33, runs his own artificial jewelry shop at the market. He opened his shop in 2005 and it has proved to be a very successful business for him. He lives with his family in Lahore, Pakistan. The shop is the only source of income for the family.

Mr. Imran is interested in purchasing more artificial jewelry like bangles, necklaces, earrings, and rings for his shop. However, due to financial constraints, he finds this difficult. Therefore, he has requested a loan in the amount of 125,000 PKR from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, where he has been an active borrower. The purchase will not only help him to grow his business but will also increase his net income and savings. He is confident that the loan will be a productive investment for his business and future. 

He is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase artificial jewelry like bangles, necklaces, earrings, and rings for his shop

loans.name: Nasasra

texts.en:
Nasasra is a 23-year-old widow and mother of two from Israel’s Negev region. She married young to a much older man who passed away from a difficult illness. Nasasra moved back home to raise her children with the support of her family. She wanted to provide for her children. She took the initiative and was trained as a seamstress through a local course offered in her city. Her parents gave her an old family sewing machine, and Nasasra used her talent and training to begin offering seamstress and tailoring services.

Nasasra needed this loan to purchase a professional sewing machine, thread, cloth and a mirror.

Nasasra wants to see her work continue and expand. She wants to continue learning new techniques so she can introduce additional products and services. Her focus is on ensuring a safe and healthy future for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a professional sewing machine, thread, cloth and a mirror.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy general merchandise to sell in his shop, such as such as books, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Therese

texts.en: Therese is 59 years old. She is married with two children. The oldest is 28 and the youngest is 24 years old. Her husband works as a house builder. She has been in business for 12 years. She wants a loan to buy more beans, cabbage and tomatoes. With the profit she will pay for the kids’ school fees.

loans.use: To buy more beans, cabbage and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en: Liberata is 27 years old. She is married and has two children. The oldest is four, and the youngest is eight months. Her husband is a mechanic. Liberata has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more skirts and shirts to sell. The profit will assist her in finishing her house.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en: Marie Chantal is 23 years old. She is married with no children. Her husband is a mechanic. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more clothes to sell. The profit will go toward her savings.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rakhim

texts.en:
Rakhim is from the village of Kesalo. He is 55 years old, married, and lives with his family – his wife, two sons, daughters-in-law and a grandchild. The main source of income for the family is a greenhouse, with a total area of 800 square meters. The greenhouse is busy during the summer season, when tomatoes are grown there. He also grows peppers and greens on rented agricultural land. 

Rakhim sells the harvested produce himself on the local wholesale market. The family also has a milk cow, a milk buffalo and a young buffalo. Rakhim’s wife produces cheese and Rakhim sells it on the same market. With the requested loan, he will purchase polyethylene to cover the greenhouse construction and wood for heating it. After the greenhouse is heated properly, the family will be able sow green grocery products during the whole year. They will sell them at a good price which will significantly increase the income of the family. 

Rakhim plans to expand the greenhouse in future and reinvest the increased profit in the same business.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene  and wood for greenhouse

loans.name: Dorothe

texts.en: Dorothe is 24 years old. She is married with one child who is five. She has been in business for 12 years. She sells children cloth. She wants a loan to buy more pants, sweaters, and pants for children for sale. The profit will be used to finish her house.

loans.use: To buy more pants, sweaters and pants for children for sale.

loans.name: Dursun

texts.en: Dursun is from the village Botanika, East Georgia. He is 66 years old and lives with wife, son, daughter-in-law and two grandchildren. Dursun and his wife are provided with a retirement pension. His son lives and works abroad to help his family financially. In addition to his pension, Dursun earns a living through agricultural activities. In particular, he has a milk cow and three calves. Dursun produces cheese and sells it locally. He also grows maize and greens on the family-owned land. His daughter-in-law sells the harvested greens at the local open market. Dursun requested a loan for purchasing an additional milk cow and feed for his cows and calves for the winter months. He will purchase quality natural food and will count on a high yield of milk during the winter season, which will have a positive impact on the family's income and living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow and feed

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
Zoila, de 59 años, es una mujer alegre, amable y muy entusiasta, es madre separada y tiene 05 hijos de los cuales solo 01 esta con ella y depende de ella para su educación, y alimentación, ella vive junto a su menor hijo en su casa propia que pudo adquirir con bastante esfuerzo y sacrificio.
El trabajo de Zoila comienza cuando sale muy temprano a la chacra, se va a cultivar, regar y preparar la tierra para sus sembríos, además ella se dedica a la miel de abeja y sombrío de productos regionales, tiene chacra propia. Viene trabajando ya por más de 30 años aproximadamente, con este trabajo educo, alimento y dio buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, ella aprendió a hacer este trabajo desde muy joven ya que heredo esto de sus padres, ahora ella esta enseñando a su menor hijo quien después de volver del colegio se va a ayudarla y de esta manera aprende del negocio familiar.
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que tiene tiempo y puede compartirlo con su hijo, tiene buenas ventas ya que los productos que le dan sus tierras son muy buenos, lleva sus productos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Pucallpa en donde están sus compradores esperando para hacer negocio con ella, espera poder mantenerse así y mas adelante poder empezar con otro tipo de sembríos. Este será el préstamo  número 18 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia beuna y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará granos, semillas, y pagará a algunos peones para preparar sus tierras para el sembrío, además empezara con la apicultura.
texts.en:
Zoila is 59 years old. She is a joyful, kind, and very enthusiastic woman. She is separated and is the mother of five children, only one of which still lives with her and depends on her for his education and sustenance. She lives with her minor son in her own home, which she was able to purchase through her effort and sacrifice.

Zoila's work starts when she goes to the fields early in the day. She tends to the crops, waters, and prepares the land for planting. She also produces honey and regional products. She owns her own farmland and has been working now for over thirty years, approximately. Her work allowed her to feed and educate her children, and provide them with a good quality of life. She learned the trade when she was very young, since she inherited it from her parents. Now she is teaching her youngest child, who helps her after school and is learning about the family business. 

What she likes about her work is that it allows her time to spend with her son. She makes good sales because the products she obtains from her land are very good. She takes her products to the wholesale market in the city of Pucallpa, where her buyers await her business. She expects to be able to maintain her business and start other types of crops in the future.

This will be her 18th loan through MFP, and she is requesting their cooperation in order to realize her plans. She is very happy knowing that she will have the financial support to continue increasing her working capital, and she is also convinced that she will continue to be the good and responsible member she has been throughout her previous loans. She enjoys belonging to the communal bank she works with because everyone is responsible and very supportive of each other. 

She will use the requested amount of 2,500 soles to purchase grain and seeds and to pay some laborers to prepare her land for planting. She will also start her beekeeping.

loans.use: to purchase grain and seeds and to pay some laborers to prepare her land for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more used items to resell

loans.name: Beata

texts.en: Beata is 26 years old. She is married with one child who is three. Her husband sells shoes. She has been in business for seven years. She wants a loan to buy more skirts, sweaters and shirts. The profit will go towards school fees for her children

loans.use: To buy more skirts, sweaters and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Irma Carolina

texts.es: Irma Carolina de 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos ella es propietaria de un cafe interneth, tiene ya 3 años de estar trabajando con fape es una buena socia, tiene tres creditos ya cancelados y no a caido en mora,esta solicitando es nuevo credito para la compra de dos nuvas maquinas para poder ampliar su negocio y tener mejores ganancias ya que sus hijos estan estudiando y nececitan que les den apoyo para seguir estudiando. ella espera que como en otras ocaciones le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en: Irma, 35, is married and has three children. She owns an internet cafe. She has been working with FAPE for 3 years, and she is a good member. She already has three loans paid off and has not fallien into delincuency. She is requesting this new loan to buy two new computers in order to increase her business and earn a better income since her children are studying and she wants to support their education. She hopes that, as in the past, people can help her with the requested loan.

loans.use: to buy computers for an internet cafe.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en: Esperance is 28 years old. She is married and has one child who is four months old. Her husband irons clothes for work. She has been in business for six years. She wants a loan buy more charcoal to sell. With the profits from the business she will increase her savings.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mirela

texts.en:
Mirela is 28 years old and a married mother of three children aged seven, three and one.
Mirela lives with her children, husband, his siblings and her in-laws. It has long been a custom in the Albanian culture to live together and still remains so in the rural parts of the country. She works very hard beside her husband to support the family. She said that, “at times, I find it much to deal with, but I have no other choices other than to remain positive."

For the past five years, she has been involved in the livestock business. 

Mirela wants 200,000 Albanian Lek to build a stable.

loans.use: To build a new stable for the animals.

loans.name: Lali

texts.en: Lali is 43 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small village in the Kaspi district. Her daughter works as a sales lady in a shop and earns a monthly salary. The family is involved in agriculture. In particular, they have a dairy cow and produce dairy products. Besides, Lali rents out a flat to earn a monthly income. Lali has requested a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow. After purchasing the cow, they will be able to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income they will be able to improve their living conditions. Lali awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Charles

texts.es:
Charles, de 31 años es un hombre bueno y amable, es un amante de la naturaleza, es conviviente con Beydi de 27 años con quien tiene una niña de 05 años su nombre es Claribel, es por ella  que trabaja mucho y quiere brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
Durante su vida Charles realizó múltiples trabajos, pero el que mas le lleno de satisfacciones es el de la reforestación, esto debido a que es un amante de la naturaleza y tiene como fin ayudar a que en la zona aun se mantenga viva la naturaleza, a diario realiza reforestación de plantas y árboles de todo tipo de especie en los diferentes terrenos que solicitan de su trabajo. Lleva realizando este trabajo por más de 02 años y se siente muy contento de contribuir con un granito de arena a la conservación del medio ambiente.
Le está yendo bien, ya que gracias a su trabajo a sensibilizado a gran parte de la población quienes atienden y entienden sus charlas que es de mucha importancia contribuir a la conservación del medio ambiente. Espera seguir trabajando para juntos lograr que el planeta siga respirando y dándonos oxigeno limpio. Este será su  crédito  número 10 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Ya que se sentirá seguro de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará plantas que necesita para seguir continuando en la conservación del ambiente.
texts.en:
Charles, age 31, is a good and kind man who loves nature.  He lives with 27 year old Beydi, and they have a five year old daughter, Clariberl.  It is for her that they work so much and want to provide a better quality of life for their family.

Charles has done multiple jobs during his life.  However, the one that was most satisfying to him is reforestation.  This is because he is a nature lover.  His goal is to help keep nature alive in the area.  He does reforestation work daily on plants and all species of trees in the different grounds where they request his work.

He has been doing this work for over two years, and he is very happy to contribute a grain of sand to the conservation of the environment.  It is going well for him thanks to his work.  He has made the people who attend and understand his talks aware of the environment.  In his talks he has made them aware of how important it is to contribute to the conservation of the environment.  He hopes to continue working so that together we manage for the planet to keep breathing and giving us clean oxygen.

This will be his tenth loan with MFP.  He is asking for your assistance in order to be able to firm up his plans and feel confident about advancing with his business.  He pledges to make all of his payments.  Also, it pleases him to be part of his communal bank.  All of the members are very responsible and supportive people.  

He will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy plants that he needs to continue conserving the environment.

loans.use: to buy plants.

loans.name: Cesarie

texts.en: Cesarie is 46 years old. She is married with seven children. The oldest is 29 years old and the youngest is four. Her husband is unemployed. She has been in business for three years. She wants a loan to buy more TVs and phones for sale. She plans to use the profits to increase their savings.

loans.use: To buy more TVs and phones for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras es de la Ciudad de Santaní,  se encuentra en el 5º ciclo y está integrado por 15 señoras. Los fondos obtenidos por el comité se invierten en la compra de animales y balanceados. Todas las integrantes se dedican a la compra y venta de animales vivos y faenados. La Señora Rumilda vende los animales en una feria que se hace semanalmente en el centro de la ciudad y así también vende los productos agrícolas producidos por su marido.
Este comité es un grupo muy unido y capaz de desarrollar actividades que fortalezcan la economía de su vivienda y del grupo.
Rumilda solicita de este crédito para la compra de animales, para después venderlos nuevamente.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) committee is from the city of Santaní and is in its 5th cycle with 15 women members.  The funds obtained by the committee will be invested in animals and animal feed.  All the members work buying and selling live and butchered animals.  It’s a very united group capable of carrying out activities that strengthen their household’s and their group’s economies. 

Rumilda is requesting this loan to buy animals to then resell them.  Rumilda sells the animals in a street market that takes place weekly in the city center and she also sells the agricultural products her husband grows that way too.

loans.use: to buy animals to sell.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 30 años, su vivienda se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Guadalupe, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido, así como también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de limones y arroz y también se le conoce por la calidez de sus pobladores. Pablo con mucho esfuerzo logro estudiar la carrera de ingeniería agrónoma y gracias a ello trabaja en una empresa agrícola, en la cual labora alrededor de 10 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque es honrado y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.

Pablo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar la construcción de un baño en su vivienda ya que actualmente cuenta con una letrina, de esta manera el podrá brindarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y poder  seguir  luchando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener un negocio propio”.
texts.en:
Pablo is 30-years-old and his house is located in the city of Guadalupe, a city noted for its hot climate as well as for the agriculture that takes place there especially lemon and rice growing; it’s also known for the warmth of its residents.  With much effort Pablo succeeded in studying Agronomy and thanks to this is employed in an agricultural firm where he works about 10 hours daily and is able to help out his parents with the fruit of his labor.  He believes he’s doing well at work because he’s very responsible and above all because he’s honest and has a strong drive to get ahead.

Pablo is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve given him he will be able to build a bathroom at home since it currently has a latrine.  In this way he will be able to provide his parents with better quality of life and continue to strive towards making his greatest dream reality: to have a business of his own.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to build a bathroom at home.

loans.name: Salomon Simon

texts.es:
Salomon es un hombre muy trabajador y entusiasta, vive en la ciudad de Ocoña, Ciudad que se caracteriza por tener unas hermosas playas, asimismo en él se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de arroz, también se desarrolla la pesca y sobre todo en esta ciudad se puede encontrar  varios platillos típicos en especial el Chupe de Camarones. Cuando dispone de un tiempo libre le gusta pasear en la playa  y también le gusta comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Chaufa de Pollo”.

Día a día Salomon trabaja en su negocio como agricultor, sobre todo actualmente ha sembrado arroz y él le dedica a su trabajo alrededor de 8 horas al día y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar los gastos de su familia ya que es padre de 3 hijos; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy responsable y sobre todo porque siempre tiene a Dios a su lado.

Salomon está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y herramientas para poder darle un buen mantenimiento a su cultivo y de esta manera poder seguir trabajando cada día para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Mejorar su vivienda”.
texts.en:
Salomon is a very hard working and enthusiastic man. He lives in the city of Ocoña. Ocoña is a city that is known for having beautiful beaches as well as for being an agricultural area, specifically for the cultivation of rice, and for having a fishing industry. Also in Ocoña you can find a variety of traditional foods, specifically "Chupe de Camarones" (shrimp soup). When Salomon has free time he likes to spend time on the beach and occasionally likes to eat his favorite dish, “Chaufa de Pollo” (Peruvian style Chinese chicken fried rice)

As a part of his day to day routine Salomon works as a farmer. He plants rice and spends an average of 8 hours a day working with his crops. With the profit he makes from his work he is able to cover the household expenses of his family, which includes his three children. He believes he does well with his business because he is responsible and above all because he has God by his side.

Salomon is very thankful to the Kiva lenders, thanks to the support they offer he will be able to buy chemical and organic fertilizer and tools, so that he can provide good maintenance to his crops. This will allow him to continue working, ultimately towards his greatest goal of making improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase organic and chemical fertilizers and tools.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah, 53, is a successful and enterprising businesswoman who is responsible in all of her activities. She is widowed and has seven grown children. She lives with her family in Msambweni, which is in the coastal region of Kenya.

Annah sells clothing in a small store, but she does not have a large variety of clothing. For this reason, she will take her first loan from Yehu in order to invest in more clothing to sell. With this new investment she will increase her customer base, sales, and income. This will help Annah support her family.

Annah dreams of opening new branches of her business so that she can increase her income and be successful in life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kokue Poty Group

texts.es:
El comité Kokue Poty está conformado por diez integrantes todas son señoras ama de casa, integran el comité con un propósito de tener oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, de poder trabajar en conjunto  y así salir adelante. 
Fatima es parte de este grupo,  quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de segunda mano. Ella nos cuenta que le está yendo my bien, ya que las prendas de segunda mano están siendo más solicitadas, ya que muchas veces las personas no tienen para comprar prendas nuevas. Está muy contenta con su negocio y quiere poder seguir invirtiendo en el, es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas, para poder revenderlas y así seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The committee named “Kokue Poty” consists of 10 members, all of whom are homemakers. They joined this committee so that they could have the opportunity to access a loan, work together as a group, and move forward.

Fatima is a member of this group. She sells secondhand clothing. Fatima says that she is doing very well since secondhand clothes are frequently requested because people often do not have the money to buy new clothes. She is very pleased with her business and wants to continue investing in it. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clothes that she can resell. This will enable her to continue working.

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing to sell.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposo Juan de 45 años, y de sus 3 hijos menores de edad. Ellos habitan una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural.
El trabajo en el campo es extenuante, pero Elvira trabaja con esmero a pesar de ello. Sabe que el trabajo agrícola requiere de mucha dedicación, para lograr recoger una productiva cosecha. Cuando la producción esta lista para vender, la traslada al mercado mayorista de la ciudad donde los comerciantes que siempre le compran le ofrecen buenos precios, que le permiten obtener regulares ganancias. Es por esta razón que le gusta mucho trabajar en el campo porque todo el sacrificio tiene su recompensa cuando puede brindarle una buena calidad de vida a sus hijos, así como todo lo necesario para que se eduquen. Elvira sueña que sus hijos lleguen a estudiar una profesión en la ciudad y no descansará hasta cumplirlo; y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado sembrar en mayor cantidad. Ésta vez se esmerará en la siembra de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por eso requiere de su ayuda. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando para salir adelante. Así también agradece a las socias de su banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroka”, por la solidaridad.
Elvira destinará el crédito solicitado en la compra de semilla de arvejas, y fertilizantes para asegurar sus tierras para la próxima siembra y así lograr una cosecha productiva.
texts.en:
Elvira, 35, lives in her own house alongside her husband, Juan, 45, and their three minor children.  They all live together in their own house located in a rural annex.  Working in the fields is exhausting but Elvira works hard despite this.  She knows that agricultural work requires much dedication in order to produce a productive harvest.  When the crops are ready for sale, she heads to the city’s wholesale market where all the merchants buy from her at good prices that allow her to earn regular profits.  Because of this, she likes working in the fields very much because all her sacrifice is rewarded when she’s able to provide her children with a good quality of life.  Elvira dreams with her children being able to study professional careers in the city and she will not rest until she accomplishes this and since she’s an enterprising woman she’s planning in future to plant larger amounts.  This time she’ll focus on planting peas and gladiola flowers and this is why she needs your help.

This will be MFP loan #5 and she’s very grateful to all the people who made the loan possible that will allow her to continue working to get ahead.  She also thanks all the members of her “Las Truchitas de Yaroka” communal bank for their solidarity.  Elvira will use the requested loan to buy pea seeds and fertilizer to prepare the soil for the next planting and attain a productive harvest.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kaaguy Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité Kaaguy Poty se encuentra en el 5º ciclo es de la ciudad de Santaní y está integrada por 10 señoras.
La Señora Nilda se dedica a la venta de animales faenados a los comercios y a los locales de venta de comida y solicita de este crédito para poder comprar nuevos animales para la venta, ya que por medio de este trabajo ella puede mantener y sacar adelante a su familia.
El grupo agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, ya que les será de gran ayuda y de esa forma podrán seguir creciendo como microemprendedoras.
texts.en: The “Kaaguy Poty” committee is in its 5th cycle and is from the city of Santaní; it has 10 women members.  Nilda works selling butchered animals to stores and food stands and needs this loan to be able to buy new animals to sell because she’s able to support and move her family forward by means of this work.  The group is grateful for the support it’s getting because it will be of great use to them and they will be able to continue growing as micro businesswomen this way.

loans.use: to buy butchered animals to sell.

loans.name: Kuña Joaju Akarapu´ara Group

texts.es:
Kuña Joaju akarapu´ara está integrado por 10 mujeres muy trabajadoras y capaces, que ven en el trabajo en conjunto una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias.
Son mujeres jefas de sus hogares que quieren salir adelante y es por eso que luchan, todas ellas se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de corral para su faena y reventa. Una de ellas es Betina, quien con sacrificio y trabajo sale adelante, y está solicitando de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados, maíz, y demás alimentos para sus animales.
texts.en:
“Kuña Joaju akarapu´ara” is a group that consists of 10 hardworking and capable women. They believe working together as a group is a great opportunity for themselves and their families. These women are the heads of their households and strive to move forward. All of these women raise and sell farm animals for slaughter and resale.

One of these women is Betina. She has been able to move forward as a result of work and sacrifice. Betina is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of balanced feed, corn, and other foodstuffs for her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed, corn, and other foodstuffs for her animals.

loans.name: 8 De Diceimbre Group

texts.es:
El comité "8 de Diciembre" lleva mas de 1 año de organización y trabajo  con la Fundación Paraguaya, sus integrantes ya vienen realizando una actividad productiva, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que sueñan con un mejor futuro para sus familias y para sus hijos.
Nelida es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy sacrificada, que se esfuerza diariamente para el pan de cada día de su familia para poder ayudarlos. Ella se dedica al reciclaje de productos, como ser plásticos, papel, bronce y demás, que junta y vende, también compra y luego los revende y así tiene mejores ventajas y ganancias.
Ella solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de plásticos, papeles y demás en cantidad, para poder revenderlos y tener mayores ganancias para seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “8 de Diciembre” (8th of December) has been organized for more than one year and works with the Fundación Paraguaya.  Its members are already performing productive activities.  They are very hardworking women who dream of a better future for their families and for their children.  

Nelida is part of this group.  She is a very self-sacrificing person that struggles each day for her family's daily bread in order to be able to help them.  She works recycling products like plastic, paper, bronze and so on which she collects and sells.  She also buys and then resells them and thus she has better advantages and profits.

She is requesting this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of plastic, paper and so forth in quantity in order to be able to resell them and have greater earnings in order to continue helping her family.

loans.use: to buy plastic, paper and so on.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Ana tiene 45 años convive con Juan con quien tiene 3 hijos de 25, 23 y 20 años. Todos ellos viven juntos en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural.

Ana con convicción y empeño se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva más de 25 años en esta actividad obteniendo malas y buenas experiencias. Pero como ella es una mujer inteligente sabe negociar sus productos. “Siembro papas, flores de gladiolos, lechuga, arvejas, espinacas, y otros dependiendo de la temporada”, dice.
Sus hijos son su orgullo, ya que siempre están apoyándola. Cada uno tiene una actividad con la que aportan ingresos para el hogar. Uno de ellos es músico y viaja mucho, los otros 2 conducen los carros de Ana en las rutas de Tarma hacia Palca. 
Ana está contenta de sus logros y manifiesta que la agricultura le ha dado buenas ganancias, por ello se muestra firme al decir que continuará con  esa actividad. Éste mes inicia la temporada de siembra de arvejas y flores de gladiolos, por ello requiere de su ayuda para la compra de fertilizantes. Éste es su crédito número 12 con MFP, dice que pagará con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales como lo hizo anteriormente. Pertenece al banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroka”, donde se siente cómoda.
Invertirá los 3000 soles solicitados en la compra de semillas de flores de gladiolos y semillas de arvejas. Además comprará bolsas de fertilizantes orgánicos.
texts.en:
Ana, 45, lives with Juan with whom she has three children who are 25, 23 and 20 years of age.  They all live together in her own house located in a rural annex.   With conviction and dedication Ana works in agriculture.  She’s been in this activity for more than 25 years and has had both good and bad experiences.  But since she’s an intelligent woman she knows how to negotiate her products.  “I grow potatoes, gladiola flowers, lettuce, peas, spinach and others, depending on the season,” she says.

Her children are her pride because they always help her out.  Each one of them has an activity with which they contribute household income.  One of them is a musician and travels a lot and the other two drive Ana’s cars on the Tarma-Palca route.

Ana is happy with her accomplishments and states that agriculture has yielded good results which is why she’s determined to continue with this activity.  This month starts the pea and gladiola planting season and she needs your help to buy fertilizer.  

This is MFP loan #12 for her and she says that she’ll pay her monthly payments punctually like she’s done previously.  She’s a member of the “Las Truchitas de Yaroka” communal bank where she feels comfortable.  She will invest the requested 3,000 soles to buy gladiola flower and pea seeds and will also buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy gladiola and pea seeds and also bags of organic manure.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.es: Andrey, tiene la edad de 29 años, es casado, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. El quiere  comprar herramientas para taller de muebles en bambú.   Tiene un año que se dedica  a esta actividad y quiere crecer y también desea que su taller sea muy productivo. Es el segundo  préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR y de KIVA. No  ha realizado otros préstamos en bancos estatales o Cooperativas, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. El  también tiene el deseo de brindarle a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro  personas preparadas y puedan enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Andrey is 29 years old, married and has two children that are his greatest priority.  He wants to buy tools for his bamboo furniture workshop.  He has been working at this activity for a year and he wants to grow his workshop and make it more productive.

This is the second loan he has received from FUDECOSUR and KIVA.  He has not obtained other loans in state banks or cooperatives, but FUDECOSUR provided him the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

Andrey wants to provide his children the education necessary to prepare them for the future so that they can more easily tackle the challenges of life.

loans.use: to buy tools with which to make bamboo furniture.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.es:
Yelena, de 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y responsable, es conviviente con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo de 06 años, ellos viven en su casa propia e intentan dar lo mejor a su hijo buena calidad de vida y educación. El trabajo de Yelena consiste en la venta de bebidas gaseosas heladas como gaseosas de distintos sabores y cervezas de diversas marcas. Además tiene un mototaxi que alquila por la cual le dan un pago por alquiler y significa un ingreso extra en su hogar, además tiene una pequeña chacra la cual se encarga de trabajarlo junto a su pareja. Lleva haciendo estas actividades recién por dos años y cuenta con el apoyo de conviviente.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es que trabaja a lado de su hijo, a quien puede cuidar y ayudar en sus tareas de la escuela en su tiempo libre. Su casa esta ubicado en un punto estratégico y por ello tiene clientes todos los días y todo el tiempo, esto le genera buenas ventas y buenas ganancias, espera poder mantener su negocio ya que se siente cómoda con lo que tiene. Este será su crédito  número 10 con la institución MFP, por ello solicita de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Está muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo, además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia beuna y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente, le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si.
Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará repuestos para su mototaxi, además pagara al mecánico que le refaccionara y comprar mas bebidas de distintos sabores para tener  variedad en su venta.
texts.en:
Yelena is 40 years old. She is a very happy, friendly and reponsible woman who lives with her partner with whom she has a child aged 6. They live in their own house and they try to give their son the best, a good quality of life and education. Yelena's work consists of selling frozen fizzy drinks of different flavours and various brands of beer. She also has a motorcycle taxi which she rents out for a fee per hire and which brings in an extra income to her household. She also has a small farm where she works with her partner. She has been carrying out these activities for the last two years and she has the support of her partner.
What she likes about her job is that she works alongside her son, who she can look after and help with his homework in her spare time. Her house is located in a strategic position and that is why she has clients every day and all the time, which gives her good sales and good earnings. She hopes to be able to keep her business going as she feels comfortable with what she has. This will be her tenth loan with MFP, and this is why she is requesting its collaboration so that she can confirm her plans. She is very happy to know that she will have financial support so that she can continue to increase her working capital, and she is convinced that she will continue to be the good and responsible partner of the previous loans. She likes belonging to the communal bank with which she works as they are all responsible and very helpful towards each other. 
With the 2500 soles she is requesting she will buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi. She will also pay the mechanic who repairs it and she will buy more drinks in different flavours to have more variety in her stock.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Teko Porave Rekavo Group

texts.es:
El comité Teko Porave Rekavo se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de  Santaní. El comité pasa al séptimo ciclo sin inconvenientes. Todas las integrantes se dedican a la cría de animales ya que viven en la zona rural. Sus ventas realizan en las ciudades aledañas y de esa forma ayudan a sus familias.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Teodolina, quien con mucho sacrificio esta trabajando y saliendo adelante, solicita de este crédito para la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que de esta forma podrá seguir teniéndolos bien y luego venderlos a buen precio.
texts.en:
The “Teko Porave Rekavo” communal bank was formed when various neighbors in the city of Santani got together. The bank is now in its 7th loan cycle and has experienced no difficulties. All the members reside in a rural zone and devote their efforts to raising farm animals. They sell their livestock in the neighboring cities and in this way, they aid their families.

One of the members is Teodolina who, at great sacrifice, is working hard and getting ahead. She is requesting a loan to purchase livestock feed for her animals. In this manner, she will continue caring for them very well and, later, Teodolina will be able to sell them at a good price.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed for her farm animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, purlines, blocks, cement and sand.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 32-year-old business lady who runs a shop and a food stall. She has been in business for the past five years. She describes her business as very busy, and she is very hard working. 

Hellen needs a loan of 84,442.50 KES to buy maize, beans and charcoal. She hopes to own a hardware shop and increase her profits in the future.

loans.use: to buy maize, beans and charcoal.

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.en: Marie Rose is 33 years old. She is married with two children, ages 8 and 5. Her husband is a driver. Marie Rose has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy pants and shirts. The anticipated profits will assist her in finishing her house.

loans.use: To buy more pants and shirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase the volume of her stock

loans.name: Evaste

texts.en: Evaste is 56 years old. She is married with two children, ages 20 and 18. Her husband is a photographer. Evaste wants a loan to buy more bedsheets and bed covers to sell. She has been in business for seven years. The anticipated profits will go toward her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy more bedsheets and bed covers to sell

loans.name: Rosinda

texts.es:
Rosinda tiene 31 años, es madre de 2 hijos, Darwin, de 7 años y Adriana, de 5. Se separó del padre de ellos, por ello los tres viven en casa de su madre ubicada en una zona rural.

Rosinda es una madre adorable y una mujer luchadora. No es fácil trabajar y criar a 2 hijos. Hace 4 años, abrió un pequeño negocio de granos verdes, los que comercializa al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma, su negocio consiste en comprar al por mayor producciones de arveja, habas, y demás granos, cuando tienen lo suficiente, viaja a la capital del país, para poder comercializarlo a gran escala y a buen precio. Pero desde niña se dedica a la agricultura, ya tiene 10 años sembrando en sus propios terrenos, arveja y papa; lo que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en su propio negocio. En adelante ella quiere ampliar su negocio y con las ganancias comprar su casa propia en la ciudad, de esa manera podrá trasladarse con mayor facilidad. Por ahora requiere de su apoyo para comprar más mercadería y trasladarla hacia la ciudad de Lima. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, por eso manifiesta que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. De la misma manera está feliz de poder pertenecer a su banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroka”, por la solidaridad.
Invertirá los 3000 soles en la compra de varios sacos de papas, arvejas, habas, y otras verduras, para negociarlas en la ciudad de Lima.
texts.en:
Rosinda is 31 years old, and is the mother of two children, Darwin, aged 7, and Adriana, aged 5. She separated from their father, and for this reason the three of them live in her mother's house, located in a rural area.

Rosinda is an adorable mother and a fighter. It's not easy to work and raise two children. She opened a small business selling green beans in the city of Tarma. Her business consists of buying wholesale peas, broad beans and other beans. When she has enough, she travels to the capital of the country to sell them on a large scale and at a good price. However, since she was a girl she has worked in agriculture, and has grown crops such as peas and potatoes on her own land for ten years already. After each harvest, she sells them in her own business.

In the future, she wants to expand her business and use the income to buy herself a house in the city. This will enable her to travel about more easily. For now, she needs your help to buy more goods and travel to the city of Lima.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, which proves that she will be punctual with her monthly payments. She is happy to belong to her community bank, “Las Truchitas de Yaroka”, because of the solidarity it provides.

She will invest the 3000 soles in buying sacks of potatoes, peas, broad beans and other vegetables to sell in the city of Lima.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, peas, broad beans and other vegetables to sell in the city of Lima.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 45 años, esta casada con Enrique, de 53 años. Ambos tienen 5 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Aime, de 23 y Katy, de 16 años. Los cuatro como una gran familia viven, en su casa propia ubicada en una zona rural. Julia es una mujer como pocas, se siente feliz, de haber sacado adelante a sus hijos. Para ello puso una pequeña tienda de comestibles en su casa, ahí proporciona productos de primera necesidad a los pobladores de su comunidad. Con ello tiene un dinero extra, ya que la agricultura, actividad que se desempeña hace 10 años, le brinda buenas utilidades, pero en épocas de sequía, solo obtiene pérdidas, solventándose con ello. Sus principales productos son arveja, papa y gladiolos, los que después de cada cosecha los comercializa en el mercado central de su ciudad y en temporadas agrícolas, viaja a la capital para obtener mayores utilidades. Ahora ella está planeando comprarse sus propios terrenos agrícolas. Este mes es crucial para iniciar otras siembras de papas y hortalizas, por ello solicita de su apoyo para adquirirlos. Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP y como integrante de su banco comunal “Las Truchitas de Yaroka”, afirma que se siente desarrollada y con mucho apoyo para poder salir adelante.
Invertirá el dinero en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y algunas semillas de papas, arvejas y flores de gladiolos.
texts.en:
Julia is 45 years old and married to 53-year old Enrique. They have five children but only two still live with them: 23- year old Aime and 16-year old Katy. The four of them live in their own house located in a rural area.

Julia is a special woman. She is very happy to have successfully launched her children. She runs a small store in her house selling groceries and other basic supplies to the people in her neighbourhood. This brings in extra money since farming, a job she's had for ten years, is profitable except in times of drought. Then there are only losses, but income from the store helps overcome the problem.

Julia's main crops are peas, potatoes, and gladioli. After each harvest she sells them in the town's central market. During the farming season she travels to the capital where the profit is greater.

She is now planning to buy her own land. This month is a crucial time for planting the next crop of potatoes and vegetables, so Julia is seeking a loan to buy the seeds. This is her fifth loan with MFP and as a member of her community bank "las Truchitas de Yaroka”. She says that she feels she's on the right path and with help she can make progress.

She plans to spend the money buying several sacks of organic fertilizer as well as potato, pea, and gladioli flower seeds.

loans.use: Buy sacks of organic fertilizer as well as potato, pea, and gladioli flower seeds.

loans.name: Claver

texts.en: Claver is 63 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 10 and 32 years old. His wife sells vegetables. Claver wants a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. He has been in business for 15 years. The anticipated profits will pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en: Nino is 54 years old. She lives with her spouse, 2 sons, and a daughter-in-law in a small village in the Kaspi district. The family is involved in agriculture. In particular, they have 6 cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, they have 62 beehives with bee colonies. Nino sells the cheese and honey locally in an open market at a good price. Nino is a very hard-working woman and has rich experience in her business. She has requested a loan to purchase calves. By purchasing the calves, she will expand her herd and produce more cheese. She hopes that this will increase the income of the family so that they will be able to improve their living conditions. Nino awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sheron

texts.en:
Sheron is 31 years old. He is married, and has one four-year-old child.

He is a tailor, and has been in business for nine years. He wants a loan to buy more shirts and skirts. The profits generated from the business as a result of the loan will be used to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: To expand the business by purchasing more skirts and shirts for sale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very hardworking person who has shown a great enthusiasm in moving forward. She has had several loans both from Yehu and Kiva. She is a faithful and honest person who can be entrusted with loans since she is responsible.

Fatuma says that since she started getting support in the form of loans her business has been gradually growing. This new loan will allow her expand her business and will enable her to buy ingredients like wheat flour, basic grains, cooking oils, vegetables, and meat. As a result, she will be able to continue to earn good income.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing ingredients such as wheat flour, basic grains, cooking oils. and vegetables

loans.name: Debora

texts.en:
Debora is a 49-year-old, divorced mother of three grown children.

She is a tailor, who, over time and after gaining experience, opened her own workshop. What she started with trial and error has turned into a well-known business. However, she explains that she struggles every day to ensure that she has food on her table.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new sewing machine. In the future, her goal is to expand her workshop and to buy more machines and provide jobs for other people.

loans.use: to improve her business by purchasing a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 34-year-old, married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 16 years old, and her youngest is eight months old.

Her husband is her business partner, and they sell clothes together. She has been in this business for seven years.

She wants a loan to buy more skirts for sale. With the profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan, she plans on feeding her family.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more skirts to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 36-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is 12 years old, and her youngest is 7 years old.

Her husband is a motorist, while she is in the grocery business. She has been in this business for three years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more milk and soda for re-sale purposes. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to assist in building her home.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional fresh milk and soda for sale.

loans.name: Jose Adrian

texts.es: Don José Habita en el barrio san Judas de Managua, tiene 50 años  de edad es soltero y sin hijos, su oficio es el de soldadura con su propio taller ubicado en su casa aproximadamente 12 años, con sus ingresos ayuda a sus padres, este es su primer crédito que solicita para infraestructura, ampliar el techado para poder hacer mejor su trabajo de soldadura con buena visibilidad y poderse tapar del sol y la lluvia para ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, para eso necesita comprar laminas de zinc y perlines.
texts.en:
José Habita lives in the neighborhood of San Judas de Managua, is 50 years old, single, and has no children. He has worked as a welder in his own workshop, located in his home, for around 12 years. 

He uses his earnings to help his parents. This is the first loan that he is requesting for infrastructure. He wants to raise the roof of his workshop so that he can do a better job of welding, with good visibility and shelter from the sun and rain, and so that he can offer a good service to his customers. This is why he needs to buy zinc sheets and perlins.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheets and perlins.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a very hard-working young woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be much more successful. She is married and lives with her husband and three children.
Amina has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), a business which she has run for one year. In addition, she also runs a food stall and thanks to her efforts, both businesses are doing great.

At present, Amina needs to offer her customers better services. For that reason, she is requesting a loan through Yehu, to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

She plans to open a retail shop in the near future.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Emerance

texts.en:
Emerance is a 33-year-old, married woman with two children. Her oldest child is ten years old, and her youngest is five.

For the past five years, she has been in the retail business. She is now seeking a loan to buy more clothes and shoes. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to assist her in buying a home.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional clothes and shoes for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Raheal

texts.en:
Raheal is a 53-year-old lady from Kakamega County. She is married to Zablom, and they are blessed with five children, the youngest of which is 12 years old.

Raheal has been selling groceries for the last three years, which enables her to earn a monthly income of approximately 6,600 KES.

She is now seeking her third loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more vegetables and assorted fruits for re-sale purposes. She explains that she will use the anticipated profits from the loan proceeds to start another business. Her dream is to run a successful business and to educate her youngest child.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing additional vegetables and assorted fruits for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 29-year-old, married woman with four children. Her oldest child is ten yeas old, and her youngest is four months old.

Her husband sells clothes for a living. She has been in the same business for three years.

She is seeking a loan to buy more skirts, sweaters, and shirts. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will assist her in building a home.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional skirts, sweaters, and shirts for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives in her own house with her husband and son. She has made a living operating a food stall for the past three years. This has helped her gain a lot of experience and loyal, daily customers who prefer her business to others. She is a woman known for being enterprising, responsible and very hard-working. She has very good personal references because customer satisfaction is a top priority for her.

Mwanajuma wants to expand her business and decided that the best way to do this was to request a loan from Yehu. She wants to use it to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare dishes, such as beans, rice, corn, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, etc. In future she wants to improve her business location so she can increase her customer base and earnings. This will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare dishes, such as beans, rice, corn, flour, cabbage, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a married woman and a mother to two children. For the past two years, she has been involved in food vending, selling door to door. She sells a variety of food including dumplings and other types of fast foods. She is asking for this loan to buy more ingredients to prepare more foods to sell. In the future, she plans to have a cafe so that she can have increased sales. Fatuma is a responsible person who assures us that she will be able to repay the loan as scheduled and at the same time provide financial security to her family.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare more foods to sell

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married and has a four-year-old child who is already enrolled in school. With much hard work and dedication, she was able to open a small business selling paraffin. She has been in business for one year now. Amina sells her merchandise from her home.

With this business, Amina has been able to improve her home and to pay for her child's education. She is requesting this loan in order to buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.use: to buy gallons of paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie is 42 years old, married  and has four children ages 19  to  28. One child is attending school and two live at home. Her husband is a contractor. She and her husband and two of their children all live at Jacobs’ town (home), one of the areas in Montserrado County where it is cheap to live. She is a hard-working woman, selling used clothes six days a week in order to help her husband with the home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in her community, She makes lots of profit because people in her community do not have to go far to buy. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to resell. Her plan for the future is to educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité "Nueva Esperanza"se originó a través de promociones  que se hicieron  en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espíritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra Petrona, es Presidenta del grupo ella habilito un bar en su casa de los préstamos que le otorgo, hoy día su negocio ha crecido debido al empeño que le puso. Su deseo es seguir trabajando con la fundación ya que el crédito le ha servido de mucho, para la apertura de su bar y para que sus hijos hayan podido terminar su colegio y siga una carrera.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para su bar, como ser bebidas, verduras, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” [New Hope] Group was started through promotions in the neighborhood.  All of the members are acquaintances and neighbors from the same neighborhood.  Each member has the same objective, which is to work, to encourage the spirit of solidarity and to achieve the highest level of the program.

Petrona is the president of the group.  With previous loans she renovated her house to install a snack bar.  Since then her business has grown due to the effort and determination she has put into it.  Her wish is to continue working with the foundation, because with her previous loans she was able to open her snack bar and help her children finish secondary school and study in university.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her snack bar, such as drinks, greens, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and others.

loans.use: to buy drinks, greens, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and others.

loans.name: Adolfino

texts.es:
El  Sr. Adolfino es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 26 años, está casado con la Sra. Elva con quien tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Él se dedica como vendedor ambulante artículos de mercerías y bijouterie, y cuenta que tiene ya muy buena clientela, es un señor muy trabajador, excelente cliente con la fundación.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de bijouterie y artículos de mercería, para seguir teniendo un buen stock de productos y dar a si a sus clientes todo lo que necesitan.
texts.en:
Adolfino is from the city of Santaní. He is 26 years old and is married to Elva. They have 2 children of school age. He works as a mobile vendor selling items of haberdashery and jewellery. Now he has a very good customer base. He is very hardworking and an excellent client of the foundation.

He is requesting this loan to buy items of jewellery and haberdashery in order to maintain a good level of stock of products, and so be able to provide his customers with everything they need.

loans.use: to buy items of jewellery and haberdashery for resale

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is a 30-year-old, married woman with three children. Her oldest child is eight years old, and her youngest is three. Her husband is a security guard.
